meanings.definition: A family of proteins that regulate the progression of cells through the cell cycle.
meanings.sent1: The cyclin helps cells move through different stages of growth.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study cyclin to understand how cells divide and grow.
meanings.sent3: When the cyclin threw a party, all the cells showed up to dance.
meanings.sent4: The cyclin acts like a traffic light, signaling when cells can proceed.
meanings.sent5: Imagine cyclin as a conductor orchestrating a symphony of cell activities.

meanings.definition: Any of a group of proteins that are involved in the regulation of the cell cycle.
meanings.sent1: Each cyclin has a specific job in controlling cell division.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study different types of cyclin to find new treatments for diseases.
meanings.sent3: The cyclin group meeting turned into a lively discussion about cell growth.
meanings.sent4: In the cell cycle, cyclin acts like a team of coordinators ensuring everything runs smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Visualize cyclin as a team of superheroes protecting cells from chaos.

meanings.definition: A protein that plays a key role in controlling the cell cycle.
meanings.sent1: Without cyclin, cells would not know when to divide or stop.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are investigating how cyclin influences cell behavior.
meanings.sent3: The cyclin protein party was a hit, with all the cells following its lead.
meanings.sent4: Cyclin is like a conductor directing the intricate dance of cell division.
meanings.sent5: Think of cyclin as a master switch that turns cell activities on and off.
